instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 16-20v
threads.message:
Hi,

here i have another board, that had power issue... i replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and now i have 16-20v on F7140. Between pins 27/28 on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> there is 20 ohms resistance, too much, right? I have replaced two <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and the result is the same... i have also replaced <CAPACITOR>C7120</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C7121</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C7122</CAPACITOR>,<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR>, but still the same. <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> is ok. What should i check next?

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 16-20v
threads.message:
27/28 value is correct (020).
I bet you have bad solders un <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> got burnt.
High-side part of <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is shorted, no other reason for 16-20V on F7140.
This happens because of bad solders; pin24 (<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>) not soldered, leaves the Gate of that MOSFET floating on the air!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 16-20v
threads.message: Thanks for the explanation, i will check that tomorrow.
